intro: Taverniera cuneifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf taverniera, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
